commit_message:
Synchronize global requirements

The cap on oslo.utils and stevedore has been removed. This patch
synchronize the requirements with the global one. It is currently
causing some version conflicts with the current version of requirements.

Change-Id: I347ca682dbebb2c77298c84e1c288f67fcbfe98f

commit_message:
Controllers deployment on controller removal

On removing of controller(s) we should deploy other controller(s).
Deployment of controllers added into ApplyChangesTaskManager
and into NodeDeletionTaskManager.

Change-Id: I74f07588b0d6baf4a5bd0599d2a0ee0fe7a6a765
Partial-Bug: #1394188

commit_message:
Fix path to neutron dsn.

The correct path is neutron.ovs_db as is also used in ml2_conf.ini.
The incorrect path has work up to now because the default alternative,
just happens to match whats in the heat template.

Change-Id: I8ffe1eb481f615b0fbe127cd8107f1e70794c839

commit_message:
Add a test case to ensure the right parameters for swap_volume

There used to be a wrong order for the parameters when calling
the method swap_volume in manager. This test case can ensure it
is called with the parameters in a right order.

Change-Id: I4b2e204eea0ab6bd5a88cf8daf4ea5e4f8b371e7

subject: Proxy update method
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-30 16:04:36.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/proxy.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/test_proxy_base.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/compute/v2/_proxy.py'], 'message': "Proxy update method

This change introduces a common update API that can be applied to every
proxy method that revolves around updating a single resource. In
particular, the change applies that base method to updating a single
server.

The method takes either a resource or an ID and calls update on the
corresponding resource.

As with other similar changes, it temporarily introduces a second verify
test method. Once this is applied everywhere, it'll be removed.

Change-Id: I2ed6ada828034afe1f79d933cedb942c3ab57c2c
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Proxy update method

This change introduces a common update API that can be applied to every
proxy method that revolves around updating a single resource. In
particular, the change applies that base method to updating a single
server.

The method takes either a resource or an ID and calls update on the
corresponding resource.

As with other similar changes, it temporarily introduces a second verify
test method. Once this is applied everywhere, it'll be removed.

Change-Id: I2ed6ada828034afe1f79d933cedb942c3ab57c2c

commit_message:
fix incorrect docstring for dispatcher

The option name is dispatcher, but the examples in docstrings of
dispatcher plugins name it as dispatchers, which is incorrect.

Change-Id: I13dd5af4a137e34e73958458125dd5d3363c49ec

commit_message:
db: clean tests to verify enable service option

The current test to verify the option "enable_new_service" is
implemented in test_service which mean we need to create and configure
the all bunch of code to verify if that option works well.  This
commit remove these tests to use two tests in test_db_api.py which
seems to be the good place to have it

Change-Id: I4d3b820859d972ff4445a1e0af66b25d910561a0

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-23 16:11:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow to define enable_snat default value

Currently neutron reset enable_snat attribute to True when enable_snat
is not provided in router external_gateway_info. But in some deployment
(private/enterprise clouds) such behavior is not the default one
expected as snat/nat/floating-ips is not used (at least by dfault).

This change defines the option enable_snat_by_default which allows to
change enable_snat value when neutron reset it. The option default
value is True for backward compatibility.

Change-Id: I455a552230ec89fe907a087c1de8c8144b5d086e
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-11-03 14:49:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow to define enable_snat default value

commit_message:
Allow to define enable_snat default value

Currently neutron resets enable_snat attribute to True when enable_snat
is not provided in router external_gateway_info. But in some deployments
(private/enterprise clouds) such behavior is not the expected default
one as snat/nat/floating-ips is not used (at least by default).

This change defines the option enable_snat_by_default which allows
deployers to set enable_snat default value when neutron resets it. The
option default value is True for backward compatibility.

DocImpact
APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1388858
Change-Id: I455a552230ec89fe907a087c1de8c8144b5d086e

commit_message:
Default route restoring and configuration

* Remove default gateway from global network file
* Add support of metric for default gateway
* Fix interface type changing in cases if we call l3::ifconfig for bridge
* Add and fix tests

Change-Id: Ieb7526878a21ace03cc5fe76512a29be0ba23ba4
Closes-bug: #1441330

commit_message:
Change GRE deployments to lookup existing mesh network role

for gre deployments we already have a role of 'neutron/mesh' defined
as the interface that we would like to use for the GRE tunnel endpoint.
This commit updates the manifest to use this value.

Change-Id: I193b07240e00a8184ea10dcc03e26dc31a69bb20
Closes-Bug: #1425070

commit_message:
Fix DHCP tag of 4095

Dragonflow was running the L2 agent in the end of the process
how ever the order matters.
This patch introduce a less intrusive approach of running the
dragonflow agent without changing the devstack order

Change-Id: I4aabe3e9869d166705f98c12fbb982a65d26490a
Closes-Bug: #1451405

commit_message:
[WIP] Split Rally framework and plugins

Rally has billions of plugins and it becomes really hard for newbies
to understand how Rally code is organized and how it works.

So let's split framework and plugins

Change-Id: I3bbbdf2696a9685d0c21fbcf7fc2b2dee248b692

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-07 10:50:13.000000000', 'files': ['functions'], 'message': 'disable errexit when inside EXIT trap

We need to turn off errexit in the EXIT trap otherwise we break out if
it early. Rookie mistake, and prevents the rest of the debug from
happening.

Change-Id: Ida7e277dd1693a6c594b2f721ddf15c9a169f07b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
disable errexit when inside EXIT trap

We need to turn off errexit in the EXIT trap otherwise we break out if
it early. Rookie mistake, and prevents the rest of the debug from
happening.

Change-Id: Ida7e277dd1693a6c594b2f721ddf15c9a169f07b

common part, the Ceph monitors and the Ceph OSDs.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-07 10:58:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/023_add_expire_reservations_index.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/017_add_encryption_information.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/026_add_consistencygroup_quota_class.py', 'cinder/hacking/checks.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/010_add_transfers_table.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/001_cinder_init.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/018_add_qos_specs.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/003_glance_metadata.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/004_volume_type_to_uuid.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/020_add_volume_admin_metadata_table.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/032_add_volume_type_projects.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/009_add_snapshot_metadata_table.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/016_drop_sm_tables.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/025_add_consistencygroup.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/008_add_backup.py'], 'message': 'Logging not using oslo.i18n guidelines (db)

Multi-patch set for easier chunks. This one addresses
the db cinder directory.

There have been quite a few instances found where the
i18n guidelines are not being followed. I believe this
has helped lead to some of the confusion around how to
correctly do this. Other developers see this code and
assume it is an example of the correct usage.

This patch attempts to clean up most of those violations
in the existing codebase to hopefully help avoid some of
that confusion in reviews.

Some issues address:
* Correct log translation markers for different log levels
* Passing format values as arguments to call, not preformatting
* Not forcing translation via six.text_type and others

Guidelines can be found here:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Hacking checks will not be able to identify all violations of
the guidelines, but it could be useful for catching obvious
one such as LOG.info("No markers!").

Change-Id: Ie2b645db143d7e12e2a38973fe963d13e46a8853
Partial-bug: 1433216
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Logging not using oslo.i18n guidelines (db)

Multi-patch set for easier chunks. This one addresses
the db cinder directory.

There have been quite a few instances found where the
i18n guidelines are not being followed. I believe this
has helped lead to some of the confusion around how to
correctly do this. Other developers see this code and
assume it is an example of the correct usage.

This patch attempts to clean up most of those violations
in the existing codebase to hopefully help avoid some of
that confusion in reviews.

Some issues address:
* Correct log translation markers for different log levels
* Passing format values as arguments to call, not preformatting
* Not forcing translation via six.text_type and others

Guidelines can be found here:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Hacking checks will not be able to identify all violations of
the guidelines, but it could be useful for catching obvious
one such as LOG.info("No markers!").

Change-Id: Ie2b645db143d7e12e2a38973fe963d13e46a8853
Partial-bug: 1433216

commit_message:
Add support for building Ceph nodes

Introduces support for CEPHSTORAGESCALE, meant to define the number
of Ceph OSDs to deploy and CEPHSTORAGE_FLAVOR which defines the nova
flavor to use for the Ceph OSDs.

Adds the logic which enable Ceph by passing needed Heat params
for configuration of the Cinder and Nova backends.

Change-Id: I6afadbcf7b17b11ec1a78e84cb1a4732d2646e2f

commit_message:
Fix for Ceilometer and external Mongo test

Parameters for creating cluster must be string variables,
so parameter 'osd_pool_size' was changed from int to string type.

Change-Id: Ie77592d1844eefdcaa4d8df6e98f463dc53366e9
Closes-bug: #1452702

subject: Save updated-in-place resources to backup stack
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-07 11:08:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/update.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_update.py'], 'message': 'Save updated-in-place resources to backup stack

The patch changes the approach of resource backup during stack
update. It stores the definition of resource that needs to be
updated in-place to backup stack(if it was not created before).

Without this functionality, InvalidTemplateReference will be thrown
every time when update-replaced resource has a reference to updated
in-place resource and stack update was failed. In this case, backup
stack has a resource that refers to not-presented another resource
and backup stack deletion generates an exception.

The patch proposed to upstream in this review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175868/

Change-Id: I80bb6b192f50fbb7e7b41bbed416f8031b7a0662
Closes-bug: #1446678
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Save updated-in-place resources to backup stack

The patch changes the approach of resource backup during stack
update. It stores the definition of resource that needs to be
updated in-place to backup stack(if it was not created before).

Without this functionality, InvalidTemplateReference will be thrown
every time when update-replaced resource has a reference to updated
in-place resource and stack update was failed. In this case, backup
stack has a resource that refers to not-presented another resource
and backup stack deletion generates an exception.

The patch proposed to upstream in this review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175868/

Change-Id: I80bb6b192f50fbb7e7b41bbed416f8031b7a0662
Closes-bug: #1446678

commit_message:
Add elevator parameter to startup kernel options, and set it to deadline.

This is change linux i/o scheduler to deadline, instead of cfq.

Change-Id: Iff947f0053577f19441c04101e5a35a7820e40a0
Closes-bug: #1418126

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 19:57:08.000000000', 'files': ['saharadashboard/tests/configs/config.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I324ca86a21c27ce43cebf255b3c075b8fe110820
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I324ca86a21c27ce43cebf255b3c075b8fe110820

commit_message:
Merge server usage tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges servers usage functional tests.

In V2.1 os-access-ip is separate plugin where in v2 it was mixed in server
plugin itself. So os-access-ip extension is enabled to run
merged functional tests for both v2 and v2.1.

Change-Id: I46bfeaed8f47ea7674f14d6f3d3b301dcc35d419

commit_message:
Merge extended server status tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges extended servers status functional tests.

In V2.1 os-access-ip is separate plugin where in v2 it was mixed in server
plugin itself. So os-access-ip extension is enabled to run
merged functional tests for both v2 and v2.1.
Also enabling required extension for v2 tests.

Change-Id: I9ec0172c52ecca3b0f4ecb34223b1762729536f5

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-24 17:47:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_patcher.py', 'nova/virt/ironic/patcher.py'], 'message': "Ironic: Remove passing Flavor's deploy_{kernel, ramdisk}

On old versions of Ironic one would set the deploy kernel and deploy
ramdisk in the Flavor as extra_specs and the driver would populate
the Ironic Node with that information. But, since a deploy ramdisk is
driver dependent (the DIB ramdisk doesn't work with agent_* drivers for
example) Ironic moved to a model where these parameters are specified
when enrolling the Node (Just like the driver). We kept it working with
the Flavor's extra_specs for backward compability reasons for more than
one cycle. Now this patch is removing the Flavor's extra_spec way of
setting the deploy ramdisk and kernel from the Ironic Nova driver.

Change-Id: I0727126770e6c79c898560a34e91a10686696d82
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Ironic: Remove passing Flavor's deploy_{kernel, ramdisk}

On old versions of Ironic one would set the deploy kernel and deploy
ramdisk in the Flavor as extra_specs and the driver would populate
the Ironic Node with that information. But, since a deploy ramdisk is
driver dependent (the DIB ramdisk doesn't work with agent_* drivers for
example) Ironic moved to a model where these parameters are specified
when enrolling the Node (Just like the driver). We kept it working with
the Flavor's extra_specs for backward compability reasons for more than
one cycle. Now this patch is removing the Flavor's extra_spec way of
setting the deploy ramdisk and kernel from the Ironic Nova driver.

Change-Id: I0727126770e6c79c898560a34e91a10686696d82

commit_message:
libvirt: cleanup unused lifecycle event handling variables from driver

When the lifecycle event handling code moved to the host module in
commit 069ad9a5b4b2cc9b49b21b09b0667909886961cf some of the
event/lifecycle variables were orphaned in the driver module and we can
remove those now.

Change-Id: Ic42db53658e618b4a5caacca1c9ef604cb126d99

commit_message:
IBP: image build: disable startup of puppet

Puppet agent start on boot should be disabled in order to prevent
possible deployment failure.

Related-Bug: #1385079
Partially implements: blueprint ibp-build-ubuntu-images

Change-Id: I2a5c7ea2a6f93f164472d4c76d09f3e4d5ddf9a5

on CentOS without rspec throwing exception:
/usr/share/ruby/test/unit/assertions.rb:1:

commit_message:
Add some testing for flavor migrations with deleted things

This just tries to further cover the migrate_flavor_data() method with
some additional scenarios of deleted instances, deleted system metadata, etc.

metadata instead of all attributes

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-12 16:00:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a test that validates object backports and child object versions

Note that this found two issues in our existing version map for Instance.
One is an ancient and harmless mismatch with InstanceFault, which is
long since irrelevant. The other was a failed bumping of the numa object.
The only thing we can really do is insert it into the current mapping at
the current version.

Change-Id: I438260b6506ce5187d8603f08dcc9b6ba5bd7004
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-12 20:28:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py'], 'message': 'Add a test that validates object backports and child object versions

Note that this found two issues in our existing version map for Instance.
One is an ancient and harmless mismatch with InstanceFault, which is
long since irrelevant. The other was a failed bumping of the numa object.
I added a relationship for it at the version of Instance when the numa
object became 1.1, which should be fine.

Change-Id: I438260b6506ce5187d8603f08dcc9b6ba5bd7004
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Add a test that validates object backports and child object versions

Note that this found two issues in our existing version map for Instance.
One is an ancient and harmless mismatch with InstanceFault, which is
long since irrelevant. The other was a failed bumping of the numa object.
I added a relationship for it at the version of Instance when the numa
object became 1.1, which should be fine.

Change-Id: I438260b6506ce5187d8603f08dcc9b6ba5bd7004

commit_message:
Adapter version is a tuple

The docstring for Adapter says that the version is a tuple like
(3,0), but the HttpClient was passing a string like "v3".

Closes-Bug: 1450272
Change-Id: I74b009d68f5601bda3ae92b3c8de1ecef00d8316

commit_message:
Spec for OpenStack clients calls retry

This specification proposes to add ability of retrying
OpenStack clients calls in case of occasional errors occurrence.

partially implements bp clients-calls-retry

Change-Id: I4d0e93ec60dfd831222df285aa2cf27f78f4a9ea

commit_message:
Polish logrotate configuration

* move custom logrotate scripts from anacron to openstack module
* use tabooext to ensure there is no overlap between Fuel's cronjob and
  the daily one
* run logrotate twice an hour
* make sure that logs are saved as root:syslog due to bug in Ubuntu
  package[1]
* fix path to logrotate configuration file in Fuel's logrotate wrapper

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/logrotate/+bug/1278193

Change-Id: Id161e8074c7fe80d69eb831db74b844094f327e7
Closes-Bug: 1450039
Closes-Bug: 1450425
Related-Bug: 1382515

subject: Need to allow merge commits in vmtp.git
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 16:31:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Need to allow merge commits in vmtp.git

Change-Id: Idc9a950b226df576d684e125845f6a6de340681c
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-06 17:01:30.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/stackforge/vmtp.config'], 'message': 'Need to allow merge commits in vmtp.git

We have 2 branches in the vmtp stackforge repository: master and kloudbuster
These 2 guys need to get in sync from time to time
I need to sync kloudbuster to its parent branch (i.e. pick up the few changes
that were committed in master and commit them to kloudbuster).
When I try to push the merge commit to gerrit I get this error from gerrit:

(venv) AHOTHAN-M-V0CS:scale ahothan$ git review kloudbuster
remote: Resolving deltas: 100% (1/1)
remote: Processing changes: refs: 1, done
To ssh://ahothan@review.openstack.org:29418/stackforge/vmtp.git
 ! [remote rejected] HEAD -> refs/publish/kloudbuster (you are not allowed to upload merges)

Which shows that I do not have the permission to push a merge commit.
So I need to add that permission to the vmtp acl file for gerrit
in order to merge

I see only 2 other stackforge repos have pushMerge permission since they
also have branches to tend to. Most repost in stackforge do not need this
because they put all their eggs in the master branch.

Hope that is clear enough and waiting impatiently for +2

Change-Id: Idc9a950b226df576d684e125845f6a6de340681c
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Need to allow merge commits in vmtp.git

We have 2 branches in the vmtp stackforge repository: master and kloudbuster
These 2 guys need to get in sync from time to time
I need to sync kloudbuster to its parent branch (i.e. pick up the few changes
that were committed in master and commit them to kloudbuster).
When I try to push the merge commit to gerrit I get this error from gerrit:

(venv) AHOTHAN-M-V0CS:scale ahothan$ git review kloudbuster
remote: Resolving deltas: 100% (1/1)
remote: Processing changes: refs: 1, done
To ssh://ahothan@review.openstack.org:29418/stackforge/vmtp.git
 ! [remote rejected] HEAD -> refs/publish/kloudbuster (you are not allowed to upload merges)

Which shows that I do not have the permission to push a merge commit.
So I need to add that permission to the vmtp acl file for gerrit
in order to merge

I see only 2 other stackforge repos have pushMerge permission since they
also have branches to tend to. Most repost in stackforge do not need this
because they put all their eggs in the master branch.

Hope that is clear enough and waiting impatiently for +2

Change-Id: Idc9a950b226df576d684e125845f6a6de340681c

[{'created': '2015-05-06 15:02:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add re-tries to Nailgun client

Sometimes, uWSGI may be shutdown for a while because of various reasons
and we should retry our requests to Nailgun and do not fall immediately.

For example, our service checker may report success to early after
Docker upgrades, because Nailgun's puppet run supervisor for a short

commit_message:
Add re-tries to Nailgun client

Sometimes, uWSGI may be shutdown for a while because of various reasons
and we should retry our requests to Nailgun and do not fall immediately.

For example, our service checker may report success to early after
Docker upgrades, because Nailgun's puppet run supervisor for a short
time (checkers get it and reports success), then start.sh stops it
(http requests to Nailgun will fail) and runs supervisor as daemon.

Closes-Bug: #1451888

Change-Id: I0e65c346181e6d5d9b17471b02561afa5abbb871
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

[{'created': '2015-04-14 16:16:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Skip test_volume_boot_pattern for GlusterFS until bug 1441050 is fixed

From the past couple of weeks the job
"check-tempest-dsvm-full-glusterfs-nv" is failing because of two
reasons:
1. Empty provider location of 'volume from snapshot'
2. Nova/Libvirt doesn't support delete snapshot when vm is off

Look at Bug 1441050 for more details. Patch [1] partially closes this
Bug 1441050.

The cinder glusterfs CI job started failing recently when
test_volume_boot_pattern was enabled in tempest, before which
the CI job was running successfully.

Hence, I am proposing this patch to skip test_volume_boot_pattern
for GlusterFS CI job, until Nova/Libvirt issue is fixed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/171482

commit_message:
Skip test_volume_boot_pattern for GlusterFS until bug 1444806 is fixed

From the past couple of weeks the job
"check-tempest-dsvm-full-glusterfs-nv" is failing because of two
reasons:
1. Empty provider location of 'volume from snapshot'
2. Nova/Libvirt doesn't support delete snapshot when vm is off

Look at Bug 1441050 for more details. Patch [1] closes this
Bug 1441050.

The cinder glusterfs CI job started failing recently when
test_volume_boot_pattern was enabled in tempest, before which
the CI job was running successfully.

Hence, I am proposing this patch to skip test_volume_boot_pattern
for GlusterFS CI job, until Nova/Libvirt issue is fixed.

This patch creates a new job template
"check-tempest-dsvm-full-glusterfs{branch-designator}" for glusterfs
specific jobs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/171482

Related-Bug: #1444806
Change-Id: I3487db550ba0966e60779b955b6796a03d2690a5

commit_message:
Move Ironic python3.4 job from experimental to gate

Change I90936cb6b6eaaf4b5e1ce67732caec3c8bdc1cc2 allows to run
`tox -e py34` command, so we can add non-voting py34 job to checks

Change-Id: I353c4c90ee655af4211c662b99d8b136ae13e685

commit_message:
Improved unit test coverage of poll_utils

Coverage of poll_utils was too small, so added few unit tests to
improve that value. Now it equals to 100%.

Change-Id: I078da533aebf5e7501c1d296db16ab0e29948599

commit_message:
Add --master-ip option for executing mos_apply_mu.py script

It turned out that relying on default IP address of the master
node is not correct in some environments, so --master-ip option
should be used at all times to specify correct IP address of
the fuel master node

Change-Id: Ia5515f18ff4ae8ab8fe1fbfb5085df73ac69b408

commit_message:
Add "Check that Compute node can be deleted and added again" test case.

Verify that Compute node can be deleted and added after Contrail cluster deploying.

Update upload_contrail_packages method and test cases with this change.

Change-Id: I0b1ef9ba5d263ef97c5b5fa2b8cb282ea4d9ddf9
Closes-bug: 1448144

commit_message:
Add type field to the resource attributes schema

Add data type for the attributes. This will help
1) validating the attibute against its type
2) resource-schema api will show the attribute type
3) template authors will know what type of value to
   expect making indexing and mapping easier
4) generating docs for the attribute type

Implements: blueprint add-type-in-attributes-schema
Change-Id: Ifc92c57ec1ddd2ab5f810587a1d33e762308dd8a

commit_message:
create/delete fake uplink by config

* Delete the fake uplink interfaces and bridge when unstacking.
* Create the fake uplink topology when stacking.
* Do both of the above subject to the CREATE_FAKE_UPLINK
  environment variable.

Change-Id: Ic39ff605fb017325d541b77a6229e321829078ad
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Setting 3-version number value

According to the last agreement on version numbers, we move the 5-digit
version number to the more semantic 3-digit version number since Kilo.

Change-Id: I3928496400036eaf5d79534cf69d011cc6926a53

subject: Execute pre/post deployment hooks on GC
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-01 22:43:55.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/executor.py', 'murano/common/engine.py'], 'message': 'Execute pre/post deployment hooks on GC

Currently pre/post deployment are invoked only for
deployment (actions). Those hooks are used to stop
AgentListener. But they were not executed for GC
phase that could also start AgentListener.  As a result
we could get 2 AgentListeners running and stealing
messages from each other

Change-Id: If96db92e38f067bfed72cfc4a3d5619de2f0fad3
Closes-Bug: #1449500
(cherry picked from commit a79955709d4a628ef7f78fec214acd2742c69aae)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Execute pre/post deployment hooks on GC

Currently pre/post deployment are invoked only for
deployment (actions). Those hooks are used to stop
AgentListener. But they were not executed for GC
phase that could also start AgentListener.  As a result
we could get 2 AgentListeners running and stealing
messages from each other

Change-Id: If96db92e38f067bfed72cfc4a3d5619de2f0fad3
Closes-Bug: #1449500
(cherry picked from commit a79955709d4a628ef7f78fec214acd2742c69aae)

[{'created': '2015-04-23 16:40:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Murano docs structure

This commit creates the Murano docs structure:

1. adds the draft folder that will be removed from the
   directory when the doc development process is over;

2. adds 4 separate folders for four types of guides
   (end user, admin user, app developer, and contributor),
   and 3 more folders for intro, appendix and images;

3. adds a single page for each section;

4. adds the link to the draft docs to the Murano landing
   page as to the beta version of the murano documentation.

To build the docs, please run $ sphinx-build doc/source doc/build
from the root directory

commit_message:
Murano docs structure

This commit creates the Murano docs structure:

1. adds the draft folder that will be removed from the
   directory when the doc development process is over;

2. adds 4 separate folders for four types of guides
   (end user, admin user, app developer, and contributor),
   and 3 more folders for intro, appendix and images;

To build the docs, please run $ sphinx-build doc/source doc/build
from the root directory.


Change-Id: I8594b01eddb0ac6cd8ce9d63553d93a1d9232ebd

commit_message:
Add catalog parameter to packages list API call

Add missed catalog=True params at environmnetns page and during
pagination next/prev button check at catalog page.
This allows to browse and add public apps to non-admin users on
respective pages.

Change-Id: I33b2a5b88975b9116f10926de1981d7d329237db
Closes-Bug: #1451703

commit_message:
Add catalog parameter to packages list API call

Add missed catalog=True params at environmnetns page and during
pagination next/prev button check at catalog page.
This allows to browse and add public apps to non-admin users on
respective pages.

Change-Id: I33b2a5b88975b9116f10926de1981d7d329237db
Closes-Bug: #1451703

commit_message:
Better ordering of HOT parameters in generated UI form

This commit makes UI generator respect parameter_groups
section of HOT template (if present). Application
name input was moved to a separate step before HOT
parameters.

Also respect label attribute of HOT parameters

Implements blueprint hot-parameters-ui-improvements

Change-Id: I43720c541d2b50660514a343f0dbe6f496ceedfd

The HOT-to-MuranoPL converter did not support some types for Heat
Template's input parameters.
Type 'comma_delimited_list' was not supported at all which was leading
to unhandled exceptions during package import operation.
Type 'json' was suported, but the generated UI definition did not
contain 'type' attribute for appropriate field, which was leading to
unhadled exceptions when the UI form was about to be displayed.

This patch fixes both these issues.

commit_message:
Fix for HOT parameter types conversion

The HOT-to-MuranoPL converter did not support some types for Heat
Template's input parameters.
Type 'comma_delimited_list' was not supported at all which was leading
to unhandled exceptions during package import operation.
Type 'json' was suported, but the generated UI definition did not
contain 'type' attribute for appropriate field, which was leading to
unhadled exceptions when the UI form was about to be displayed.

This patch fixes both these issues.

Closes-Bug: #1450536

Change-Id: I539514cc7cd884f98278cf5c990e8833e1b09259

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 19:39:18.000000000', 'files': ['muranoclient/openstack/common/apiclient/base.py', 'muranoclient/openstack/common/apiclient/client.py', 'muranoclient/common/utils.py', 'muranoclient/shell.py', 'muranoclient/tests/fakes.py', 'muranoclient/v1/packages.py', 'muranoclient/common/http.py', 'muranoclient/openstack/common/cliutils.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I5d325e9397404211df00d9e39195b63d9a2f2e76
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I5d325e9397404211df00d9e39195b63d9a2f2e76

commit_message:
Run heat_integrationtests in parallel

This should improve the turnaround time of the gate tests and
also make room for more integration tests.

Also, remove duplicate addCleanup.

Change-Id: Iacdd554ee13bb87b0b71ebf547209f94e945f342

commit_message:
Adds ability to delete docker applications from the host

Application deletion were supported on DSH/Pod but not exposed
in DockerApplication. Once it became exposed number of bugs in
KubernetesPod and DSH became visible.

Change-Id: I33650936a73994668f72348a909b7a51bae2b98c
Closes-Bug: #1446582
(cherry picked from commit a74293e2b4ed5695737066d9154d51a4170b8a80)

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 19:36:24.000000000', 'files': ['manilaclient/shell.py', 'manilaclient/openstack/common/apiclient/client.py', 'manilaclient/openstack/common/cliutils.py', 'manilaclient/openstack/common/apiclient/base.py', 'manilaclient/client.py', 'manilaclient/httpclient.py', 'manilaclient/config.py', 'manilaclient/openstack/common/apiclient/utils.py', 'manilaclient/openstack/common/_i18n.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Ib86c36f81f6fdbee64d88dd0b1d126bcc16649ac
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Ib86c36f81f6fdbee64d88dd0b1d126bcc16649ac

subject: Fix RabbitMQ ocf_run with the timeout command.
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-04 10:20:04.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nova/files/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': "Fix RabbitMQ ocf_run with the timeout command.

W/o this fix, the timeout command is used with rabbitmqctl
wrapper, which uses a 'su' when invoked as not a rabbitmq user.
This is an issue as the 'su' changes the original
process group. And if the timeout command expired, it would kill
only processes in this original process group, leaving orphaned
commands what do not belong to whis group anymore.

The solution is to issue all timeout wrapped rabbitmqctl commands
as the rabbitmq user in the OCF script.

Closes-bug: #1446241

Change-Id: I139255237fd34b555f248cb826deb13b7e134e8d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit b725527d92c31373c84cd780dcf1ad10933f4955)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix RabbitMQ ocf_run with the timeout command.

W/o this fix, the timeout command is used with rabbitmqctl
wrapper, which uses a 'su' when invoked as not a rabbitmq user.
This is an issue as the 'su' changes the original
process group. And if the timeout command expired, it would kill
only processes in this original process group, leaving orphaned
commands what do not belong to whis group anymore.

The solution is to issue all timeout wrapped rabbitmqctl commands
as the rabbitmq user in the OCF script.

Closes-bug: #1446241

Change-Id: I139255237fd34b555f248cb826deb13b7e134e8d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit b725527d92c31373c84cd780dcf1ad10933f4955)

subject: Fix RabbitMQ apps eval in OCF
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-04 10:32:48.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nova/files/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Fix RabbitMQ apps eval in OCF

W/o this fix, if there are no apps running and rabbit node is actually
not functioning, get_status() would still report 0 considering the rabbit
resource is running. This is an issue as it may lead to the situations
when the resource reported OK, but in fact, the rabbit node is not a cluster
member.

The solution is to not rely only on which_applications() eval exit code
and test if the kernel app is running. Otherwise consider the pacemaker
resource is "not running" as well.

Closes-bug: #1446251

Change-Id: Ia2fcb18abb3d977c5fcb26bfdeac864b6834f478
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit bc4a7ec8093db81d8d1de478788825e228890b05)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix RabbitMQ apps eval in OCF

W/o this fix, if there are no apps running and rabbit node is actually
not functioning, get_status() would still report 0 considering the rabbit
resource is running. This is an issue as it may lead to the situations
when the resource reported OK, but in fact, the rabbit node is not a cluster
member.

The solution is to not rely only on which_applications() eval exit code
and test if the kernel app is running. Otherwise consider the pacemaker
resource is "not running" as well.

Closes-bug: #1446251

Change-Id: Ia2fcb18abb3d977c5fcb26bfdeac864b6834f478
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit bc4a7ec8093db81d8d1de478788825e228890b05)

[{'created': '2015-05-04 10:32:11.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nova/files/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Fix RabbitMQ apps eval in OCF

W/o this fix, if there are no apps running and rabbit node is actually
not functioning, get_status() would still report 0 considering the rabbit
resource is running. This is an issue as it may lead to the situations
when the resource reported OK, but in fact, the rabbit node is not a cluster
member.

The solution is to not rely only on which_applications() eval exit code
and test if the kernel app is running. Otherwise consider the pacemaker
resource is "not running" as well.

Closes-bug: #1446251

Change-Id: Ia2fcb18abb3d977c5fcb26bfdeac864b6834f478
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit bc4a7ec8093db81d8d1de478788825e228890b05)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix RabbitMQ apps eval in OCF

W/o this fix, if there are no apps running and rabbit node is actually
not functioning, get_status() would still report 0 considering the rabbit
resource is running. This is an issue as it may lead to the situations
when the resource reported OK, but in fact, the rabbit node is not a cluster
member.

The solution is to not rely only on which_applications() eval exit code
and test if the kernel app is running. Otherwise consider the pacemaker
resource is "not running" as well.

Closes-bug: #1446251

Change-Id: Ia2fcb18abb3d977c5fcb26bfdeac864b6834f478
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit bc4a7ec8093db81d8d1de478788825e228890b05)

commit_message:
Enable Internet for slave nodes

Adds NAT features to the slaves in the VirtualBox scripts, now
for Linux and OS X (Yosemite) systems:
* It requires the sudo password (giving explantions on the reasons)
* For OS X, it backups the original pf.conf before setting the NAT
  using pfctl, and does some cleanups
* For Linux, inserts the masquerade rule in the nat chain

Change-Id: Id37cb55241682f530a7e5378cadd556cccc1db90
Closes-Bug: #1442988

commit_message:
Add functional tests for stack tags/hidden stacks

One test creates a stack with a tag, updates the 
tag and then deletes the tag. The second test, 
creates a stack with a tag named 'hidden'. In heat.conf, 
hidden_stack_tags is set to 'hidden' which means 
whichever stack has a tag named 'hidden', stack.list() 
should not pick it up.

blueprint stack-tags

Change-Id: Idf6669ccf5e210d4e6da3733a9ac190418306d98

commit_message:
Added new mapping type: threshold

HashMap module now manages thresholds.
Thresholds only work on numerical values.
You can set thresholds on a field value or service quantity.

Change-Id: I665e9cd943bb620c016dcf78afbc096a3bce470b

commit_message:
Adds network verification feature description for 6.1

Beginning with 6.1, the Fuel web UI provides
several new warnings for network verification:

- failed net verification (updated UI warning)
- net verification in progress
- net verification that must be done before deployment

All changes will be brought into User Guide.

Change-Id: If8b4d9ab201325cd73cc8742f7f9f6a3ea701032

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
check DPD interval and timeout for IPSec site connection

While creating and updating IPSec Site Connection, the DPD interval should be lesser than DPD timeout.
this Condition can be validated at client side.

This patch validating the interval and timeout for update and create forms.

Change-Id: I039149190358ca6a6b53ba75c8f08267047b201b
Closes-Bug: #1451440

commit_message:
Update unit tests for Kilo

This updates unit tests to pass with recent Kilo refactoring and
enhancements.  A few irrelevant tests were removed, specifically
those that tested a specific state where routers have no management
port, which is no longer a possible state.

Change-Id: I67ed703a4bfe0460c1bcf6336dda602e295deac7

scheduled for removal with the rpc api version bump to 2.0.

 - instance_get_all_by_host()
 - instance_get_all_by_host_and_node()

Furthermore, it removes these previously deprecated manager methods:

Manager methods that are deprecated and scheduled for removal on the
next rpc version bump are annotated with a todo comment if not there
already.

Finally, the last_refreshed parameter of vol_usage_update() is made
optional in the manager to prepare for its removal on the next rpc
version bump.

commit_message:
Cleanup conductor unused methods

There are some conductor api methods left unused that can be removed
together with two very old manager methods that were deprecated and
scheduled for removal with the rpc api version bump to 2.0.

This change removes the following unused api client methods:

 - instance_get_all_by_host()
 - instance_get_all_by_host_and_node()
 - migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node()
 - aggregate_metadata_get_by_host()
 - block_device_mapping_create()
 - block_device_mapping_update()
 - block_device_mapping_update_or_create()
 - block_device_mapping_get_all_by_instance()
 - compute_node_update()
 - compute_node_delete()
 - security_groups_trigger_handler()

Furthermore, it removes these previously deprecated manager methods:

 - ping()
 - instance_get_active_by_window()

Manager methods that are deprecated and scheduled for removal on the
next rpc version bump are annotated with a todo comment if not there
already.

Change-Id: Ia825cee94e6ba9431a85c1b6f64cb26e7c83c95f

commit_message:
Jshint removing Hogan and static_url

Hogan and STATIC_URL are only use in a few files. Hence, we do not really
need them enabled globally. Removing them from jshint global config.

Change-Id: I0881ab0e6668a47bf795e422e17f9f025a010d31
Closes-bug: #1452464

commit_message:
Fix InvalidRequestError being skipped

The sqlalachemy api module was skipping the error and returning the
empty list as a result of the search. The malformed requsts should be
treated as errors not as successful empty result.

Change-Id: I5a5d4def003d15ec2c3c80b2940b586585eeb198

commit_message:
Build translated RST manuals

Build translated RST manuals. This needs openstack-doc-tools 0.26
release, thus bumped up requirements.

Import also Japanese User Guides translations so that this can be
tested. We only create an empty file for it, this will trigger the
import and enable us testing of the toolchain.

Ignore some build results.

Change-Id: Ic51974445730cbfa886beb7cfd4fcf71977dab3c

Change-Id: Ib4f551ad303bd44f0a5c45fc9d5f7d53f376caf7
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add kilo tag to keystone compose file

Previously, the keystone compose yml was referencing juno instead
of kilo when all other services are using kilo. This patch upates
the yml to use the keystone image with the kilo tag.

Change-Id: Ib4f551ad303bd44f0a5c45fc9d5f7d53f376caf7

subject: Use cento base image for data volumes
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-13 14:42:28.000000000', 'files': ['docker/mariadb-data/Dockerfile', 'docker/nova-compute/nova-compute-data/Dockerfile'], 'message': 'Use cento base image for data volumes

There is no good reason to use the full PREFIX image for data
volumes.  It just takes up extra disk space and increases load times.
Instead use the centos base image for our two data volumes.  Note
the volume mounts in the data volumes will not be modified on a docker
pull of this new image.

Change-Id: I7f0540e34dac5b15306137ece80b66fc304882a5
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use cento base image for data volumes

There is no good reason to use the full PREFIX image for data
volumes.  It just takes up extra disk space and increases load times.
Instead use the centos base image for our two data volumes.  Note
the volume mounts in the data volumes will not be modified on a docker
pull of this new image.

Change-Id: I7f0540e34dac5b15306137ece80b66fc304882a5

commit_message:
Change compose files to always launch Kilo version

Since we are releasing Kilo version of openstack, lets default
to the Kilo packages until configuration of the yml files is supported.

Change-Id: Ie1c49e99ab1de12480d6683b0e74dbb17da61598
Partially-implements: blueprint port-kilo

Fix for deadlocks in TestActionLogs

in threads are complete.

A new attribute 'is_federated' was recently added to token object.
When performing an upgrade, the existing token object stored in the
session will not have this attribute yet.  This patch fixes the issue
by providing a default value so it won't interrupt service for existing

Closes-bug: #1451934
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-05 18:53:37.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/user.py'], 'message': "Set default value for new token attributes

Two new attributes were recently added to token object:
'unscoped_token' and 'is_federated'. When performing an
upgrade, the existing token object stored in the session
will not have the two attributes yet.  This patch fixes
the issue by providing a default value so it won't interrupt
service for existing login user during an upgrade.

Change-Id: I6adf974876294168e2326b5e10c14da2dd3e52ea
Closes-bug: #1451934
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Set default value for new token attributes

Two new attributes were recently added to token object:
'unscoped_token' and 'is_federated'. When performing an
upgrade, the existing token object stored in the session
will not have the two attributes yet.  This patch fixes
the issue by providing a default value so it won't interrupt
service for existing login user during an upgrade.

Change-Id: I6adf974876294168e2326b5e10c14da2dd3e52ea
Closes-bug: #1451934

commit_message:
Remove cleanfail->cleaning from state diagram

This removes the state transition: 'clean failed' to 'cleaning',
from the state machine diagram.

The transition had been added (but not actually used) and subsequently
removed; see Ieda2fcd78332a063c51685cd01bb824014f0f4a8.

commit_message:
Remove update_db decorator from attach method

Remove update_db decorator from attach call because
'save' method will be called two times. As 'save' is
called from attach method itself, there is no need of
'update_db' decorator.

Closes-Bug: 1435748
Change-Id: I689017c9b15a233ffa9070046465fec0fce3e096

commit_message:
Remove config-ref tables that shouldn't be there

autohelp.py doesn't remove old configuration tables, and the cleanup
hasn't been done recently. This patch removes tables that should have
disappeared.

Change-Id: I3e8b7433871116b74970ca7ad0affd345557641d
Closes-Bug: #1448122

This little helper/tool script can be used to

that a taskflow user would typically perform and
can be used to spot obvious issues with the various
stages (which can then be used to guide where changes

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add speed-test tools script

This little helper/tool script can be used to
profile (at a very high level) the various stages
that a taskflow user would typically perform and
can be used to spot obvious issues with the various
stages (which can then be used to guide where changes
should be made to improve the overall stage speed).

Change-Id: Ib3a69801280bcacc56e3a4a88c4d24e4fae4d353

subject: Speed up memory backend via a path -> node reverse mapping
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 01:23:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Speed up memory backend via a path -> node reverse mapping

A simple reverse mapping/dict is added and used to avoid
repeated linear finding of paths (where able to).

For linear flow with 500 dummy nodes:

Old
---

Took 0.255 seconds to run building
Took 0.456 seconds to run compiling
Took 50.039 seconds to run preparing
Took 0.796 seconds to run validating
Took 2.853 seconds to run running

New
---

Took 0.254 seconds to run building
Took 0.457 seconds to run compiling
Took 30.780 seconds to run preparing
Took 0.776 seconds to run validating
Took 2.222 seconds to run running

Change-Id: Idc9ce88865b58a2dffd2e8955f0fab7f056d92b3
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-06 06:11:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Speed up memory backend via a path -> node reverse mapping

repeated linear finding of paths, and metadata (and a little

commit_message:
Speed up memory backend via a path -> node reverse mapping

A simple reverse mapping/dict is added and used to avoid
repeated linear finding of paths, and metadata (and a little
tiny helper inode class) is added so that each node knows
its full path (avoiding repeated traversal to determine
this same info).

For linear flow with 500 'dummy' nodes on an old machine
running python 2.6 (your numbers will vary):

Old
---

Took 0.255 seconds to run building
Took 0.456 seconds to run compiling
Took 50.039 seconds to run preparing
Took 0.796 seconds to run validating
Took 2.853 seconds to run running

New
---

Took 0.254 seconds to run building
Took 0.457 seconds to run compiling
Took 30.780 seconds to run preparing
Took 0.776 seconds to run validating
Took 2.222 seconds to run running

Change-Id: Idc9ce88865b58a2dffd2e8955f0fab7f056d92b3

commit_message:
Revert "Ironic: do not destroy if node is in maintenance"

Surprisingly this is changing some people's workflow where a user reports
brokenness, they put the node in maintenance before they forget, user
clean up or ship data off the node and deletes it.

This reverts commit 06f80e7bdf951dcd4e29cd19b85c6a7e632040e4.

Related-Bug: #1443374
Change-Id: I42c187908068e59e4af958b68ed1be5e7f41e119

commit_message:
Update rc support a manifest change

Currently, we don't support a manifest change when we update a rc.

This patch fix this problem so that we can update the replica count
 or other useful attributes of a rc.

Change-Id: I8e42768f215c6dd30fae6e1a9f20cf34bfe8bd93
Implements: blueprint magnum-resource-manifest-update

commit_message:
Update service support a manifest change

Currently, we don't support a manifest change when we update a service.

This patch fix this problem so that we can update the label or other
useful attributes of a service.

Change-Id: Ibecf97ce3a356d1eb83315e5e635e738f06cd47a
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-resource-manifest-update

commit_message:
Add option to show hidden stacks in stack-list

A new boolean stack-list option, "--show-hidden", will result in hidden
stacks (stacks with tags listed in the hidden_stack_tags Heat engine
configuration option) being included in the stack-list output.

Example:
  heat stack-list --show-hidden

blueprint: stack-tags

Change-Id: I452d8e23739b7f7bdb4c06e3a9c21c93de25e3d3

commit_message:
Add section header to state machines page

This adds a section header so that a "Table of Contents" is
displayed on the rendered page. This makes the page consistent
with the rest of our developer documentation, since the others
all have a Table Of Contents.

I also added the word 'provisioning' to qualify what kind of
states were being depicted here. (As opposed to power states.)

Change-Id: If71679d9a5ee795c6c3a9d912f371ea04cea2753

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 21:41:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix Python 3.4 test failure

In Python 3.3 and newer, the IOError exception is now OSError and does
not contain a 'message' attribute.  Use the __str__() function to
retrieve the message.

Change-Id: I33518204207c5de1f807d2559b253b513537d577
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-06 22:08:08.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/msftocs/msftocsclient.py'], 'message': "Fix Python 3.4 test failure

In Python 3.3 and newer, the IOError exception is now OSError and does

commit_message:
Fix Python 3.4 test failure

In Python 3.3 and newer, the IOError exception is now OSError and does
not contain a 'message' attribute.  Use the args[0] attribute to
retrieve the message.

Change-Id: I33518204207c5de1f807d2559b253b513537d577

commit_message:
Fix negated services with common prefix

The current sed matching mixes up common-prefix matching;
e.g. "-q-lbaas,q-lbaasv2" is changed into just "v2"

This is more verbose, but I think more reliable.  See also
Ib50f782824f89ae4eb9787f11d42416704babd90.

Change-Id: I3faad0841834e24acc811c05015625cf7f848b19

commit_message:
Implement configurable MN client

Allow the midonet client to be configurable in Neutron.  This
patch makes the following changes:

 * Define the base abstract client class that defines the
   interfaces that the clients implement.
 * Define the API and Cluster based clients
 * Replace the use_cluster config with the client config
 * Modify the plugin to instantiate the client based on the config
   specified, and call its methods
 * Mock the client in the unit tests and remove the unnecessary
   tests
 * Minor unit test cleanup

Change-Id: Id68ae66e5cea9f8c080a880746113be047e33022
Implements: MNP-122

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I695d2141c00a5ee36e042efbb9bac4e2803c1948

commit_message:
empty non-string values are returned as string traits

when an integer or float trait are 0 or 0.0, sql backend incorrect
returns them as string traits.

Change-Id: I70b311e24bfab264bc2623a5089cd7971041896e
Closes-Bug: #1450042

subject: build-images: drive DIB via YAML config file
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-15 01:56:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'build-images: drive DIB via YAML config file

Adds a new build-images python script which can be used to build
multiple DIB images at once using a YAML (or JSON) config file.

The YAML configuration format looks like this:
  disk_images:
    -
       imagename: overcloud-compute
       arch: amd64
       type: qcow2
       elements:
         - overcloud-compute
       packages:
         - vim
       options:

The motivation for this script is to be able to use it
as a replacement for the growing number of environment
variables required to get devtest_overcloud.sh working
in all environments.

commit_message:
build-images: drive DIB via YAML config file

Adds a new build-images python script which can be used to build
multiple DIB images at once using a YAML (or JSON) config file.

The YAML configuration format looks like this:
  disk_images:
    -
       imagename: overcloud-compute
       arch: amd64
       type: qcow2
       elements:
         - overcloud-compute
       packages:
         - vim
       options:

The motivation for this script is to be able to use it
as a replacement for the growing number of environment
variables required to get devtest_overcloud.sh working
in all environments.

Change-Id: I5087b178253805379778ab19f093483d56b5a811

subject: Delete swarm bay also delete related containers
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 08:29:19.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/db/test_bay.py', 'magnum/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Delete swarm bay also delete related containers

Currently, when we delete a swarm bay, we didn't delete related
container and these containers are useless.

This patch delete the related containers when delete a swarm bay.

Change-Id: I8fbbba38de4db8a87b2894751075bddee6e129ad
Closes-Bug: #1452167
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Delete swarm bay also delete related containers

Currently, when we delete a swarm bay, we didn't delete related
container and these containers are useless.

This patch delete the related containers when delete a swarm bay.

Change-Id: I8fbbba38de4db8a87b2894751075bddee6e129ad
Closes-Bug: #1452167

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-05 05:17:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Provide best-effort option in scaling policy

This patch added best-effort option to both ScalingInPolicy and
ScalingOutPolicy. If user defines this option to True, scaling

Implements: blueprint scaling-policy-simple
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-05 05:58:21.000000000', 'files': ['examples/policies/scaling_policy.spec', 'senlin/policies/scaling_in_policy.py', 'senlin/policies/scaling_out_policy.py'], 'message': 'Provide best-effort option in scaling policy

This patch added best-effort option to both ScalingInPolicy and
ScalingOutPolicy. If user defines this option to True, scaling
policy will resize the cluster to its minimum or maximum size

Implements: blueprint scaling-policy-simple

commit_message:
Provide best-effort option in scaling policy

This patch added best-effort option to both ScalingInPolicy and
ScalingOutPolicy. If user defines this option to True, scaling
policy will resize the cluster to its minimum or maximum size
when scaling count breaks the size limitation.

Change-Id: I2270855fd967e1a76c2cbd1278b6305a95c62063
Implements: blueprint scaling-policy-simple

commit_message:
Add rw functional tests for private share types

Add base client methods for share type access operations and use them in
rw functional tests.
This commit covers case of 'private' share types and access to them.

Partially implements bp rw-functional-tests

Change-Id: Ic3ab35ba25867ead6e40c6b830c551cdfc9e859d

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 19:12:27.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/openstack/common/_i18n.py', 'ironicclient/openstack/common/apiclient/base.py', 'ironicclient/openstack/common/apiclient/utils.py', 'ironicclient/openstack/common/apiclient/client.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Ic21066211a071591854280a93a53bb2255cb8ad3
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Ic21066211a071591854280a93a53bb2255cb8ad3

commit_message:
libvirt: add method to get hardware info to Host

This commit moves parts of code about to retrieve host
hardware information as total of memory size, memory size used
and the number of cpu, from libvirt.driver to libvirt.host

Change-Id: I615249eb14b6972f1aedb5de1a24952291930160

Provide a deprecation warning for old functionality

Create a deprecation utility function. Convert some of the deprecation
comments from within keystoneclient into DeprecationWarnings.

commit_message:
Introduce functional testing to cinderclient

Just add the functional directory and a base test
to run.  Also includes the necessary update to
requirements and tox.

Note this also sets .testr.conf to just tests/unit
for now.  Otherwise any time we run tests it will
pick up functional as well, and we don't have that
env setup yet.

Change-Id: I141fd5edd488da92b1bf044e9c8dcc4cb14be62c

commit_message:
Update the certs with stronger ciphers

The current key/pem have weak ciphers that sometimes can
trigger security flags.  Recreated these with
stronger and more up to date ciphers.

Change-Id: Id85b6724854e6bd80b66d576e63d87f37b3b8c17
Closes-Bug: #1450182

commit_message:
nova client now support limits subcommand

Added new subcommand "limits" which displays absolute limits and
rate limits both. do_limits() functions calls get() only once and
then passes limits.rate and limits.absolute to _print_rate_limits
and _print_absolute_limits respectively; these functions then
format the output.

Change-Id: I1344da1a3925a3f3a757e340f11381b69a668bf7
Closes-Bug: #1172254

commit_message:
Fix queue producer handler to send ids

Also renaming queueworker.py to controllerworker.py to be more
obvious what it is.  This patch should complete the api to queue to
controller worker workflow (i.e. it should work).

Change-Id: Id924e83674dab1a5f13e57533dd5272c3d667b7d
Closes-Bug: #1452141

commit_message:
Make delorean.repo overrideable

Make the delorean.repo file name overrideable via $DELOREAN_REPO_FILE
since Delorean Kilo uses a different repo file name than Delorean Trunk.
For example:
http://trunk.rdoproject.org/kilo/centos7/current/delorean-kilo.repo

Change-Id: I71723d174197c209ec892b14cf057500b4d82083

subject: Update the tempest install environment
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-05 07:06:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Update the tempest install environment

While this should be backported this purpose of this commit
is to unblock gating and provide for the always changing
requirements within tempest while also allowing us to ensure
that we are defcore complaint.

Tempest is not an integrated service within OpenStack and does
not adhere to any given package or requirement set that would
in a real work function with the rest of OpenStack. Because
tempest is intended to be a standalone system that is not
installed along side of the rest of OpenStack it general will
break and or introduce new requirements that break the services
that depend on various versions of packages as found within
global requirements. To fix this issue tempest is now being
installed within a VENV. The virtual environment will ensure
that tempest is installed in a location where it can resolve
its own dependencies without general impact to the rest of the
system.

Change-Id: Ib972704084ead5748b19362b142fb161fea4a734

commit_message:
Update the tempest install environment

While this should be backported this purpose of this commit
is to unblock gating and provide for the always changing
requirements within tempest while also allowing us to ensure
that we are defcore complaint.

Tempest is not an integrated service within OpenStack and does
not adhere to any given package or requirement set that would
in a real work function with the rest of OpenStack. Because
tempest is intended to be a standalone system that is not
installed along side of the rest of OpenStack it general will
break and or introduce new requirements that break the services
that depend on various versions of packages as found within
global requirements. To fix this issue tempest is now being
installed within a VENV. The virtual environment will ensure
that tempest is installed in a location where it can resolve
its own dependencies without general impact to the rest of the
system.

Additionally, we removed the heat_contrib_extraroute heat
plugin from the build process because its presently
incompatible with PBR >= 0.11.0 which is related to issue
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1450733 .
However we have already built wheels in our repo which will
still allow this contributing plugin to be installed as an
integrated part of the system. Currently, we git clone heat
source onto heat_engine containers and install selected plugins
via a 'python setup.py install'.  This change removes the tasks
that do that and simply adds heat-contrib-extraroute
to heat_pip_packages so it gets installed on all heat-related
containers.  This is actually only required on the heat_engine
containers but the package is tiny and should not cause any issues
being present on the heat_api containers.

Change-Id: Ib972704084ead5748b19362b142fb161fea4a734

commit_message:
List all packages installed in snapshot

Creates files for Fuel Master and all slaves
called installed-rpms.txt and installed-debs.txt.
Both commands are run for all slaves, but RPMs
are checked just for Fuel Master.

blueprint package-fuel-components

Change-Id: Iec27e87127b6ec630e4fb0efd6e0fa9b01b7c141

commit_message:
Use ODL_RELEASE instead of version number to determine release

The latest stable/helium build is version 1.0.4 and that broke
the logic being used to determine if Opendaylight release was
Helium or Lithium. Instead of playing games with the numbers,
let's just use the newly introduced $ODL_RELEASE variable.

Change-Id: I8b33aeed205b4b4cf43beeba1cbe6b722dfba920

commit_message:
Nova deprecated proxying options in the DEFAULT group

In Kilo Nova deprecated proxying options in the DEFAULT group.  Instead
they were moved to the "neutron" group.  This resulted in the metadata
service not serving up metadata.

See this bug for more information:

    https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1217999

Change-Id: I4f7eac0100d31c5329f8d1857f6d7da1bb6784da

commit_message:
Support media repo creation

This change set supports the media repository creation against the
Virtual I/O Server if it has not already been created.

This fixes a long standing TODO in the nova-powervm code for initial
standup.  This was enabled due to changes made back in pypowervm to
support unordered elements.

Change-Id: I84a8f80a8fdb16ba2d48a70862d2cd0058ebaaa1

commit_message:
Make neutron work with Kilo

Neutron was loading a bunch of modules that are not currently
supported in Kolla.  Remove them as they were causing problems
loading Neutron.

Partially-Implements: blueprint port-kilo

Change-Id: If53071bbb0a22aa05219b9e99ca6d693f96db4ce

commit_message:
Add lock_path and instances_path to config

Both of these paths were missing from the configuration
but they appear necessary for Kilo.  I'm not clear on why
it worked ok in Juno, perhaps different defaults.

Change-Id: I8b7c375627ada860356f9b9fcc205751083b804c
Partially-Implements: blueprint port-klo

commit_message:
Move dnsmasq-neutron.conf to /etc/neutron/dnsmasq

The default dnsmasq configuration file doesn't operate with the Kilo
agents in /etc/neutron when used with the --config-dir option.  Instead move
it to a subdirectory.

Change-Id: Iab8a54e879f8e630ba38205750ca9670e82834df
Partially-Implements: blueprint port-kilo

commit_message:
The neutron dockerfile needs an update for Kilo

policy.json comes from the openstack-neutron package and is required
for the agents to run.  So install it.  fwaas_driver.ini has been deleted
in master and in the kilo branch, but the agents won't run without the
file present.  So copy one from the Juno release.

fwaas_driver.ini is probably not actually required, but there is a
configuration problem somewhere in our Neutron code base.  We are out
of time for the Kilo branch, so this short term workaround should be fine.

Change-Id: I154599925308765349634b1a53e598599fc20ec1
Partially-Implements: blueprint port-kilo

[{'created': '2015-05-02 16:31:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Glance has some undefined dependencies in Kilo packaging

Glance has two undefined dependencies.  Without installing these
dependencies out of band, glance will not operate.

Change-Id: I096881467d8e0022d58e6c6f745e610d9332dd82
Partially-Implements: blueprint port-kilo
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-02 17:29:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Glance has some undefined dependencies in Kilo packaging

commit_message:
Glance has some undefined dependencies in Kilo packaging

Glance has two undefined dependencies.  Without installing these
dependencies out of band, glance will not operate.

Change-Id: I096881467d8e0022d58e6c6f745e610d9332dd82
Partially-Implements: blueprint port-kilo

commit_message:
Make nova read config files for Kilo

In Kilo, nova no longer reads the config files automatically.  They must
be specified in the command line to run the nova-* tools.

Change-Id: Ifbdf4fd3f952f7bb65e9937b46cf9b96e262c3b0
Paritally-Impleents: blueprint port-kilo

commit_message:
Change neutron configuration to work with i, j, k

The neutron configuration variables used in a previous version
of this patch work on Juno only.  They fail with Icehouse without
warning.  Instead just use variables that work on all three versions
of OpenStack.

Change-Id: I0d9c6e5a25510287c9da59164d5bc3f64815213d

subject: Add a novnc container running the novnc-proxy.
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-04 22:37:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'new: Add a novnc container running the novnc-proxy.

All VNC-specific configuration bits are moved from nova-api-base to
nova-compute and this container. The compose specification has been
updated as well to build a novnc-proxy.
Supervisord is used to run nova-consoleauth in the same container, this
is needed for caching the tokens from nova-api.

A future patch will make the desired backend configurable (spice/vnc).

Change-Id: I8b64abf125fd1ecd7d3463515e3717dd9bd60420

commit_message:
Add a novnc container running the novnc-proxy.

All VNC-specific configuration bits are moved from nova-api-base to
nova-compute and the new nova-novncproxy and nova-consoleauth
containers. The compose specification has been updated to reflect this.

A future patch will make the desired backend configurable (spice/vnc).

Change-Id: I8b64abf125fd1ecd7d3463515e3717dd9bd60420
Blueprint: novnc-container

commit_message:
Clean Gemfile: drop rspec-puppet and rake

Both of rspec-puppet and rake get pulled in by puppetlabs_spec_helper
so there is no need to keep them in the Gemfile.

Change-Id: I6eec0cd69b34689db1b3adbe48cca43874cc7d9d

commit_message:
Fix exponentially growing AJAX updates for table rows

Schedule next table rows update only when the last row was
updated. Since unit-test for this fix relies on a blueprint
replace-qunit-tests-with-jasmine it is moved to a separate commit to
speed up this fix merge, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/179013/

Closes-Bug: #1263665
(cherry picked from commit ca090378b4875afebdebd67bdb457eebad6b2b7d)

Conflict Resolution Notes:
cherry-pick needed to have the old body of the complete: function
manually removed - it wasn't sure if it still belonged (resulting in
nearly duplicate code) or should be removed. I'm a bit surprised the
cherry-pick didn't auto-resolve.

Conflicts:
	horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.tables.js

Change-Id: Id603a4fde5713d8f2b85b1dcf72c82c93a87c755

subject: Trait_* models have incorrect type for key
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-28 23:08:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Trait_* models have incorrect type for key

Each of the TraitText, TraintInt, TraitFloat
and TraitDatetime have key column which has
its type defined incorrectly as Integer. The
migrate script correctly defines the type as
String(255).

This fix updates the sqlalchemy Trait* models
to define key as String(255).

Closes-Bug: 1449752

Change-Id: I5ac2e9b811e3baa53e329732233cd0011a4d25b9

commit_message:
Trait_* models have incorrect type for key

Each of the TraitText, TraintInt, TraitFloat
and TraitDatetime have key column which has
its type defined incorrectly as Integer. The
migrate script correctly defines the type as
String(255).

This fix updates the sqlalchemy Trait* models
to define key as String(255).

Closes-Bug: 1449752

Change-Id: I5ac2e9b811e3baa53e329732233cd0011a4d25b9

commit_message:
api: record severity change in alarm history

A useless change was done on the original alarm object when
we update the alarm. That have the side effect to hide the change
from the history.

This change fixes that

Change-Id: I9b3030dacf0da83bc0570ed4a6f9d460f178e2be
Closes-bug: #1452264

debootstrap: fix syntax issues

There's no need for 'break' to exit a switch case, ';;' will work fine.

commit_message:
Fix 'vcenter_vlan_cindervmdk_cinder_ceph' test case

- mistake in test is following: it deploys cinder (LVM) and ceph nodes,
  but disables all block storage settings
- it is not possible to use both LVM and Ceph backends for Cinder
  simultaneously, so do not combine ceph-osd and cinder roles
- add multiple vCenter clusters to test cases 'vcenter_vlan_cindervmdk_cinder_ceph'
  and 'vcenter_vlan_cinder'
Change-Id: I72f7a3391a7934533dd21afb4e9936937b842f49
Closes-bug: #1450542

commit_message:
Fix api-site syncing

The check for api-site was wrong. Reworked the script so that it's
clearer what needs to be done for each project:
* Split up new function copy_glossary_xml
* Pass explicit parameter instead of global variables

Change-Id: I29cd7f3f7d2ce09e5a214633d292db793924eda0

commit_message:
Adds OCS Power and Management interfaces

Includes support for the Open CloudServer (OCS) chassis manager
power operations. The OCS design has been contributed by
Microsoft to the Open Compute project.

Implements blueprint msft-ocs-power-driver

Change-Id: Ic2c90ab5c8d79c55ae83dd485b3cf9281b600c23

commit_message:
Update galera_cluster stanza for HAproxy example

As Openstack support for multi-node writes to MySQL with Galera nodes
is not production ready yet (see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2014-September/005166.html ),
update the HAproxy configuration example to use 2/3 nodes as a backup.

Closes-bug: #1419699

Change-Id: I3a6771a998f5962fac747ece47461e8c33228791
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
